column4: Having problems connecting on my wireless G card, need urgent help. The card shows up on my "lsusb" command, it is able to view my home network, it is NOT able to connect to it.
iwconfig output?
No such device
you dont have drivers?
lsusb just lists devices connected trough usb, you need drivers in order for your OS to work properly with your hardware
lsusb shows connected hw not the drivers. Which card do you have?
which device I mean
Belkin wireless G FSD7050
gimme a sec
no problem, thanks
I think you need http://packages.ubuntu.com/lucid/rt73-source
rt73 driver
apt-cache search rt73 should get you somewhere
It says I have duplicate sources that "you may want to run sud apt-get update to correct these problems
you should actually always do apt-get update before that, it updates you package index
so try that first and let me know
Ok, ran it first, then the search and it says the same thing
what exactly does apt-cache search r73 returns?
The search returns the message I typed before about the duplicates
I'm guessing if you search for anything else (apt-cache search irssi) for instance you get the same result?
Correct.
irssi - terminal based IRC client
